revised_title: Studying the Stability of Adaptive Enzymes in Bacteria
tldr: The authors studied the stability of an adaptive enzyme in bacteria during growth in different media. They found that the enzyme's stability increases with more prolonged exposure to D-arabinose and that the secondary lag in D-arabinose after growth in glucose is connected to the stability of the adaptive enzyme in glucose. The results provide insights into the complex history of adaptive changes in bacteria.
